name: Payment Model
definition: How money flows between the government payer, intermediaries, and service providers. Whether payment is prospective or retrospective. What data triggers the payment. What determines the payment amount.
probing_questions: Is payment fee-for-service, capitated, bundled, or prospective?
What data input triggers the payment?
Is payment issued before or after service verification?
Are there payment caps per beneficiary, provider, or service category?
What determines the payment amount — fixed schedule, cost report, negotiated rate?

name: Verification Structure
definition: Who generates the data that determines payment, and whether there is independent verification before or after payment. The lag between payment and verification, and the verification frequency.
probing_questions: Who generates the data that determines payment?
Is there independent verification before payment?
Is there independent verification after payment, and by whom?
What is the lag between payment and verification?
How frequently does verification occur?

name: Eligibility Controls
definition: The barriers to becoming a participating provider, supplier, or plan. Credentialing, licensing, and enrollment requirements. How long enrollment takes. Barriers to beneficiary enrollment or eligibility.
probing_questions: What are the barriers to becoming a participating provider or supplier?
What credentialing, licensing, or enrollment requirements exist?
How long does provider enrollment take?
What are the barriers to beneficiary enrollment or eligibility?
Are there periodic re-enrollment or re-credentialing requirements?

name: Clinical Criteria
definition: What clinical judgments determine eligibility or payment. Whether criteria are based on objective measures or subjective assessment. Who makes the clinical determination.
probing_questions: What clinical judgments determine eligibility or payment?
Are criteria based on objective measures (lab values, imaging) or subjective assessment?
Who makes the clinical determination — the treating provider, an independent reviewer, or the patient?
Is there a second opinion or independent medical review requirement?
How frequently must clinical eligibility be re-certified?

name: Service Delivery Visibility
definition: Where services are delivered and what institutional witnesses or verification mechanisms exist. Whether service delivery can be independently confirmed. Electronic verification systems in place.
probing_questions: Where are services delivered — facility, home, community, telehealth?
What institutional witnesses or verification mechanisms exist?
Can service delivery be independently confirmed by someone other than the provider?
Are there electronic verification systems (EVV, EHR timestamps, GPS)?
Is there a physical record of the service encounter?

name: Change Velocity
definition: Whether this is a new or recently expanded program. How enrollment or spending has changed in the last 3-5 years. Whether oversight infrastructure has scaled proportionally. Recent waivers or flexibilities.
probing_questions: Is this a new program or a recently expanded one?
How has enrollment or spending changed in the last 3-5 years?
Has oversight infrastructure scaled proportionally with growth?
Were there recent waivers, flexibilities, or emergency authorities?
Are there sunset provisions or pending regulatory changes?

name: Intermediary Structure
definition: How many entities sit between the government payment and the actual service delivery. What financial flows pass through intermediaries. What is visible to the payer versus opaque.
probing_questions: How many entities sit between the government payer and the service provider?
What financial flows pass through intermediaries?
What is visible to the government payer versus opaque?
Do intermediaries have their own financial incentives that diverge from program goals?
Are there related-party transactions or common ownership arrangements?
